title: Why has Dean Gaffney been axed from EastEnders?
text:
Dean in an EastEnders scene from earlier this year (Picture: BBC/Kieron McCarron)

Dean Gaffney has allegedly been axed from EastEnders.

The actor, who played Robbie Jackson on the soap, has already had his final scenes aired as Robbie was seen leaving the country to take care of his son Sami who has been injured in a car accident.

Here’s what we know so far about what happened…

Why has Dean Gaffney been axed from EastEnders?

According to the Daily Star, Gaffney has had his EastEnders contract terminated after ‘begging a stranger for sexy pictures’.

Theresa Hayman, a dental nurse, reportedly alleged that Gaffney, 41, messaged her on social media in the middle of the night asking her for the photographs of her ‘boobs and bum’.

To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

A source said: ‘Dean knows he’s made some bad decisions and he is working hard to get his life back on track. He split up from his long-term girlfriend and then he lost his job. But he knows he only has himself to blame.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘He’s always been a popular member of the cast and everyone loves Robbie Jackson so it’s a real shame that he will no longer be on our screens.’

They added: ‘Dean knows that he was given a huge opportunity when he returned to EastEnders full-time two years ago after a number of guest stints. But his break-up with Rebekah hit him hard and he spent a lot of the summer out in Ibiza. Whenever he wasn’t filming he’d be off for the weekend.

‘He was telling friends out there what had been going on and how he was coming to the end of his contract when his bosses found out what he’d done and decided not to renew his contract for now.’

Back in March, Gaffney split from his girlfriend of three years.

An insider told The Sun at the time: ‘Dean hit the jackpot when he got together with Rebekah but now she’s told him to take a hike.

‘She got bored of his antics and felt like a trophy on his arm, not a girlfriend he treasured and wanted to marry. Dean was gutted when it happened but Rebekah had reached the end of her tether and left him.

‘She feels like she is better off by herself and seeing as Dean thinks he’s some kind of stud, he’ll no doubt manage to charm someone else into being his girlfriend in no time.’

Advertisement

Advertisement

Metro.co.uk has approached EastEnders for comment.

Advertisement Advertisement
description: Robbie Jackson has already been seen leaving the country to take care of his son Sami, who has been injured in a car accident.
